title: Chris Williamson MP loses court battle to be reinstated to Labour Party
text:
An MP suspended by the Labour Party after claiming it had been “too apologetic” over allegations of anti-Semitism has lost a High Court bid to be reinstated to the party.

Chris Williamson was suspended by Labour in February after a video emerged of him making the comments at a meeting of the pro-Jeremy Corbyn campaign group Momentum.

He was allowed back into the party in June after being given a formal warning by Labour’s National Executive Committee, but was then resuspended after an outcry at the decision from MPs, peers and Jewish groups.

The Derby North MP was handed an additional suspension on September 3 in light of further allegations of misconduct, including “undermining the party’s ability to campaign effectively against anti-Semitism”.

At the High Court on Thursday, Mr Justice Pepperall ruled the June re-suspension should be overturned, but the subsequent disciplinary action should go ahead.

Referring to the June decision, he said: “The Labour Party acted unfairly in that there was no proper reason for reopening the case.”

However, he found the September 3 decision was taken in “good faith”.
description: An MP suspended by the Labour Party after claiming it had been “too apologetic” over allegations of anti-Semitism has lost a High Court bid to be reinstated to the party.
